Two of the cups are already filled with tea while tea is being poured into one. There is also a container of creamer and another with sugar cubes on the table.

description-en: On this advertisement for Lipton's Tea, a set of three tea cups can be seen on a table with a white tablecloth and a vase of flowers. Two of the cups are already filled with tea while tea is being poured into one. There is also a container of creamer and another with sugar cubes on the table. (sp)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The advertisement alludes to the 'proper' way to drink tea and the choice of tea as also perhaps a sign of class and refinement. (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Much pre-Independence tea advertising (including the majority of the relevant images in the Paul Collection) suggests such a target audience, emphasizing comfortable bourgeois domesticity and the elaborate and expensive (by Indian standards) equipment required to brew a "proper" cup of tea (as in the gleaming bone china "tea service" as in this image).(Philip Lutgendorf)(gs)
